sentence: David Ross Sat, 19 Feb 2005 11:29:45 -0800
In IRS Publication 557, the sample draft articles of incorporation indicate that NO compensation may be paid to directors.
In fairness, reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses on behalf of the organization -- including travel and lodging to attend board meetings -- are allowed.
However, Publication 557 does not explicitly prohibit compensation to directors.
As far as state laws go, you must follow the laws for the states (1) in which the organization is incorporated and (2) in which the organization operates.
For an organization that is incorporated in Maryland and has its headquarters in Maryland, the laws of Maryland apply without regard to the states in which the directors live.
